item.title: Bree add a quote by Paul Graham
item.description: "Someone trying to live well would seem eccentrically abstemious in most of the US. That phenomenon is only going to become more pronounced. You can probably take it as a rule of thumb from now on that if people don't think you're weird, you're living badly." -- Paul Graham

item.title: Bree add a quote by Louis Sachar
item.description: "What amazes me is that most days feel useless. I don't seem to accomplish anything-just a few pages, most of which don't seem very good. Yet, when I put all those wasted days together, I somehow end up with a book of which I'm very proud." -- Louis Sachar

item.title: Bree add a quote by Robert Wright
item.description: "...human beings are a species splendid in their array of moral equipment, tragic in their propensity to misuse it, and pathetic in their ignorance of the misuse." -- Robert Wright

item.title: Bree add a quote by Calvin Trillin
item.description: "She believed in the principle of enoughness." from "About Alice" -- Calvin Trillin

item.title: Bree add a quote by Chad Bagley
item.description: "As for fluff, I have nothing against it. It's fluff that parades as something loftier that I don't like." -- Chad Bagley

item.title: Bree add a quote by Avi
item.description: "For heaven's sake, don't write writing. Write reading!" -- Avi

item.title: Bree add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The exquisitely bad is as satisfying to the soul as the exquisitely good. Only the mediocre is unendurable." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Bree add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week." -- Charles Darwin
